Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk pki-base
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: pki-core enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated pki-core packages that add one enhancement are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) Core contains fundamental packages required by Red Hat Certificate System.
This update adds the following enhancement:
* Some TLS libraries now warn or refuse to validate DNS names when the DNS name only appears in the Subject Common Name (CN) field, which is a practice that was deprecated by RFC 2818. This update adds the "CommonNameToSANDefault", which copies the Subject Common Name to the Subject Alternative Name (SAN) extension, and ensures that certificates are compliant with current standards. (BZ#1429492)
Users of pki-core are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which add this enhancement.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
